title: 114_hr2440
content: The loan repayment program of the National Institutes of Health is being improved by amending Part G of title IV of the Public Health Service. This includes redesignating sections and introducing a new section 487H for the loan repayment program. The Secretary will establish a program for health professionals to engage in research in exchange for up to $50,000 annually towards their educational loans. Starting in 2017, the Secretary can adjust this amount for inflation. Health professionals must have a significant amount of educational loans relative to income to qualify for the program. The program established by the Secretary offers up to $50,000 annually towards educational loans for health professionals engaging in research. The amount can be adjusted for inflation starting in 2017. Health professionals must have substantial educational loans relative to income to qualify. The program follows certain provisions regarding obligated service and appropriations remain available for two fiscal years. Other loan repayment programs are also updated. The loan repayment program for research on acquired immune deficiency syndrome is amended to increase the maximum amount from $35,000 to $50,000 annually. This adjustment aligns with inflation starting in 2017 and follows specific provisions regarding obligated service. The loan repayment program for research on contraception and infertility is amended to increase the maximum amount from $35,000 to $50,000 annually. This change aligns with inflation and specific provisions for obligated service. Additionally, a similar adjustment is made for clinical researchers from disadvantaged backgrounds.
